definition: main line (of communication)/main thread (of a plotline or concept)/central theme
owner/master/host/individual or party concerned/God/Lord/main/to indicate or signify/trump card (in card games)
thread/string/wire/line/CL:條|条[tiao2],股[gu3],根[gen1]/(after a number) tier (unofficial ranking of a Chinese city)
variant of 線|线[xian4]

sentences.english: “There is a common thread” among these stories, Verveer said.
sentences.chinese: 韦维尔说，所有这些故事“都有一条共同的主线”。

sentences.english: All of these callbacks happen on the main thread of the application.
sentences.chinese: 这些回调全部发生在应用程序的主线程上。

sentences.english: The main thread writes bytes read from the channel into the pipe.
sentences.chinese: 主线程把从通道读取的数据写到管道中。

sentences.english: There is a while loop in the thread.
sentences.chinese: 是调用主线程里的无模式对话框吧？

sentences.english: This thesis is based on our sports public goods as of the main line.
sentences.chinese: 本篇硕士学位论文是以我国体育公共产品为研究主线。

sentences.english: Benoni, Four pawns attack, Main line.
Terminates when the main thread has requested.
sentences.chinese: 在主线程发出请求时结束。

sentences.english: This transforms the main thread of the calling process into the control dispatcher.
sentences.chinese: 这将把调用进程的主线程转换为控制分派器。

sentences.english: Mainline is the codeline that has no baseline.
sentences.chinese: 主线是没有基线的代码线。

sentences.english: They do of course have to check that nothing else has been changed on the mainline in the meantime.
sentences.chinese: 当然，他们必须检查同时主线上没有发生任何变更。

sentences.english: Feng Shui is permeated with a for people to "stay out of trouble, " the main line.
sentences.chinese: 风水学贯穿着一条为人们“趋吉避凶”的主线。

sentences.english: The central themes of the story are the struggle for civil rights and the Vietnam conflict.
sentences.chinese: 故事的主线是越战和公民权之争。

sentences.english: The plotline gives global audiences a chance to see American troops get killed.
sentences.chinese: 情节主线使得全球观众有机会一睹美国军队被杀。

sentences.english: To get this fix into the mainline, there are two options.
sentences.chinese: 想要在主线中修复它，有两种选择。

sentences.english: Locke's theory of knowledge runs through the thread of the truthfulness of knowledge.
sentences.chinese: 洛克知识论贯穿知识确实性主线。

sentences.english: So that Ron subplot was secondary to the central drive of the story.
sentences.chinese: 对于故事的主线的发展就是次要的了。

definition: branch line/side road/spur/fig. secondary plot (in a story)
theme/subject
axis/principal axis (in mechanics, optics, botany etc)/main axle (of engine)
to be oriented towards/orientation
to run through/a connecting thread from beginning to end/to link
the whole front (in a war)/the whole length (of a road or railway line)
to revolve around/to center on (an issue)
bidirectional/two-way/interactive
gist/main idea/general tenor/one's judgment
paragraph/section/segment/stage (of a process)/classifier for stories, periods of time, lengths of thread etc
surname Duan
logic (loanword)
theme or subject (music)
arteries and veins/network of blood vessels/vascular system (of a plant or animal)/(fig.) fabric (i.e. underlying structure, as in "social fabric")/overall context
itinerary/route/political line (e.g. right revisionist road)/CL:條|条[tiao2]
guide/forerunner/pioneer
long term
